definition: (military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands/(fig.) to take a turn for the worse
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: Asian shares lost ground while U.S. stock futures were pointing to a steady open on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲股市纷纷失守，美国股指期货开盘走稳。

sentences.english: The text was lost when jerusalem was lost in 1187 .
sentences.chinese: 1187年其版本随同耶路撒冷的失守而丢失。

sentences.english: The fort fell without a shot being fired.
sentences.chinese: 要塞一枪没放就失守了。

sentences.english: Should this level give way, the 2011 lows near 1250 could come under pressure.
sentences.chinese: 一旦失守，则今年最低位1250附近将面临压力。

sentences.english: Top of the barracks, fell is a turning point.
sentences.chinese: 阿齐齐亚兵营的失守是一个转折点。

sentences.english: He still controls Tripoli, but eastern Libya has fallen to the uprising.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲仍控制着首都黎波里，但利比亚东部已经失守。

sentences.english: Technically, HSI failed to hold 18000 level, suggesting trend remains weak.
sentences.chinese: 技术上，恒指失守18000关口，反映走势仍偏淡。

sentences.english: A few days after the fall of Mukden, Harry Truman was elected president of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 就在沈阳失守几天以后，杜鲁门当选美国总统。

definition: to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to lose what one has just obtained (idiom)
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to surrender (of a fortress)/to fall (to the enemy)/subsidence (of land)
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
to fall into enemy hands/to be occupied/to degenerate/to submerge
to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
